name: Letheryl
flavortext: "No, I can't say this is exactly my 'comfort zone' - we departed that happy Grove quite some time ago. But I suppose it's all fallen on me, hmm? 'An elf bleeds the same as anyone,' as they say, so I've got quite a weight on my shoulders..."

features.name: Trance
features.text: Rather than taking long rests, I go into a meditative trance for four hours per day.

features.name: Darkvision
features.text: I can see in dim light within 60 feed as if it were bright light, and in darkness as if it were dim light.

features.name: Fey Ancestry
features.text: I have advantage on saves against being charmed, and I cannot be put to sleep using magic.

features.name: Incisive Sense
features.text: I have advantage on Insight and Investigation ability checks.

features.name: Fey Presence
features.text: As an action, cause all creatures in a 10' cube in front of me to make a Wisdom save against my warlock spell save DC. On failure, they are charmed or frightened until the end of my next turn.

features.name: Researcher
features.text: When I attempt to learn or recall a piece of lore, if I don't know it, I often know where and from whom I can obtain it. Usually this is a library, university, or other learned individual. The DM might rule that it is inaccessible or does not exist.

personality.ideal: It is my duty to fulfill the tasks set before me.
personality.flaw: I miss the luxuries I was accustomed to, and rarely pass up an opportunity to indulge in them again.
traits: I'm curious; I like knowing and being in the know.
I'm clean; the dirt and sweat of a life on the road does not suit me.
bonds: I am honor bound to fulfill my good friend Il'viranyaâ€™s dying request.
I owe Llyrethe my life, and trust her implicitly.

invocations.name: Agonizing Blast
invocations.text: I add my charisma modifier to Eldritch Blast damage.

invocations.name: Mask of Many Faces
invocations.text: I can cast disguise self at will without expending a spell slot.

spells.pretext: 2 spell slots, regained on short rest

equipment: A letter from Il'viranya, warning of an impending calamity
